page.title: 04SHIFT WORK, ROSSINGTON PIT
page.content: A Rossington miner reports, " When we have had our safety equipment checked we go to Number One Shaft to wait for a lift to take us down to where we work. When we arrive underground we travel on 'Paddy Trains' which take us to the coal face. In the Rossington Pit there are over 50 miles of underground railway track in use and 'Paddy Trains' carry men and equipment to and from the coal face. We take our meal break underground in South Yorkshire we call it 'snap', this usually lasts 20 minutes. When our shift is over we return to the surface by lift. We hand in our checks and safety equipment . Then we go and change out of our overalls and go for a shower. After this we return home."
